title: ICE during type checking

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code Using the following dependency: ```toml wyrm = { version = "0.9.1", features = ["fast-math"] } ``` ```Rust use wyrm::{Arr, IndexInputNode}; fn main() { let x = IndexInputNode::new(&[0; 1]); let input: Vec<_> = (0..1).map(|_| x).collect(); input[0].set_value(Arr::zeros(2)); } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.63.0-nightly (ec55c6130 2022-06-10) binary: rustc commit-hash: ec55c61305eaf385fc1b93ac9a78284b4d887fe5 commit-date: 2022-06-10 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.63.0-nightly LLVM version: 14.0.5 ``` ### Error output ``` Compiling rust v0.1.0 (/home/research/dev/hutter/rust) error[E0599]: no method named `set_value` found for struct `Variable` in the current scope --> src/main.rs:7:14 | 7 | input[0].set_value(Arr::zeros(2)); | ^^^^^^^^^ | ::: /home/research/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/wyrm-0.9.1/src/lib.rs:192:8 | 192 | fn set_value(&self, T); | --------- the method is available for `Variable` here | = help: items from traits can only be used if the trait is in scope help: the following trait is implemented but not in scope; perhaps add a `use` for it: | 2 | use wyrm::DataInput; | help: there is an associated function with a similar name | 7 | input[0].value(Arr::zeros(2)); | ~~~~~ error[E0271]: type mismatch resolving `::Dim == ndarray::dimension::dim::Dim<[usize; 2]>` --> src/main.rs:7:24 | 7 | input[0].set_value(Arr::zeros(2)); | ^^^^^^^^^^ expected an array with a fixed size of 2 elements, found one with 1 element | = note: expected struct `ndarray::dimension::dim::Dim<[usize; 2]>` found struct `ndarray::dimension::dim::Dim<[usize; 1]>` note: required by a bound in `ndarray::impl_constructors::>::zeros` --> /home/research/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/ndarray-0.11.2/src/impl_constructors.rs:188:32 | 188 | Sh: ShapeBuilder, | ^^^^^ required by this bound in `ndarray::impl_constructors::>::zeros` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_infer/src/infer/error_reporting/need_type_info.rs:856:33: unexpected path: def=ndarray::ArrayBase substs=[_, _] path=Path { span: src/main.rs:7:24: 7:27 (#0), res: Def(TyAlias, DefId(20:11 ~ wyrm[2d3a]::Arr)), segments: [PathSegment { ident: Arr#0, hir_id: Some(HirId { owner: DefId(0:10 ~ rust[461b]::main), local_id: 40 }), res: Some(Err), args: None, infer_args: true }] } thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/ec55c61305eaf385fc1b93ac9a78284b4d887fe5/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1339:9 stack flags: --crate-type bin -C opt-level=3 -C embed-bitcode=no note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [typeck] type-checking `main` #1 [typeck] type-checking `main::{closure#0}` #2 [typeck_item_bodies] type-checking all item bodies #3 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack Some errors have detailed explanations: E0271, E0599. For more information about an error, try `rustc --explain E0271`. ```
